intro: Eriospermum deserticola, commonly known as the desert eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Eriospermum deserticola is often found growing in sandy soils and is well-suited to survive in harsh, desert conditions.
